clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Ventilatory Strategies During Laparoscopic Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Re-expansion of Atelectasis During Laparoscopic Surgery. Recruitment Maneuver vs Positive End-expiratory Pressure: a Randomized Study

brief_summary.textblock: Atelectasis involving declive areas often occurs during general anesthesia and may persist postoperatively. This phenomenon could be amplified by pneumoperitoneum and Trendelenburg position. Hypothesis: To evaluate whether the shape of the airway pressure-time curve, Stress Index (SI), during constant flow inflation can lead ventilator setting during general anesthesia.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.time_frame: Continuous evaluation during time of surgery. Partecipants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 1 weeks
